summary.name: Manifest
summary.description: This is the digital (and physical) supply chain for Manifest itself. Manifest is, according to the [about](http://manifest.supplystudies.com/about/) page: "an investigative toolkit intended for researchers, journalists, students, and scholars interested in visualizing, analyzing, and documenting supply chains, production lines, and trade networks."

overview.name: Manifest
overview.description: Welcome to Manifest! This is an evolving map of the supply chain for Manifest itself. We already loaded another map for you to look at, but you can check out others like: * A map of Western Electric's telephone from 1927. * A copy of Apple's supplier report from 2013. * The supply chain for a hard disk drive. * A list of Amazon Fulfillment Centers in 2016. * Or a look at a typical laptop computer's supply chain. Manifest is a toolkit intended for researchers, journalists, students, and scholars interested in visualizing, analyzing, and documenting supply chains and trade networks.

overview.name: Abelohost
overview.description: Abelohost is the web hosting provider for Manifest (and [supplystudies.com](https://supplystudies.com) more generally). It is a Dutch host with an emphasis on privacy.

overview.name: Serverius B.V.
overview.description: Serverius is one of the two data center providers used by Abelohost. According to the site, it is "a carrier-neutral Netherlands datacenter. It is located just a few miles away from Amsterdam in the heart of the Netherlands. The company is unique for its high quality services and its array of available networks. It is located in a perfectly stable environment, which makes it possible to build private networks and co-locate private hardware. The datacenter consists of the newest and most reliable technology: its high capacity co-location is protected with air conditioning, Tier 3 emergency power, efficient climate control services and modern fire extinguishers." This is the primary site.

location.address: Serverius B.V. Ketelskamp 10 7942 KG Meppel -, Netherlands

overview.name: Github
overview.description: Manifest uses Github to store its code, despite this, Github is a problematic service in a numnber of ways, not the least of which is its [contractual agreement with ICE.](https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2020/01/ice-contract-github-sparks-developer-protests/604339/)

location.address: 88 Colin P Kelly Jr St San Francisco, CA 94107

overview.name: Nginx
overview.description: Nginx is a webserver package originally developed by Igor Sysoev in 2002. It was acquired by F5, a cloud application services company, in 2019. Manifest is served from a Nginx webserver running on Linux.

overview.name: Leaflet
overview.description: Leaflet is an open-source JavaScript library for creating interactive maps. Originally created by Vladimir Agafonkin, it is now actively developed by a community of contributors. Manifest uses Leaflet for its geospatial visualizations.

overview.name: D3
overview.description: D3 is a JavaScript library for data visualization originally created in 2011 by Mike Bostock, Jeffrey Heer, and Vadim Ogievetsky. Manifest uses D3 for its non-geospatial visualizations.

overview.name: Node.js
overview.description: Node.js is an open-source JavaScript runtime environment, now supported by the OpenJS Foundation. Manifest uses node to provide a number of backend services.

location.address: 548 Market St. PMB 57274. San Francisco, CA 94104

overview.name: Development Hardware
overview.description: Development for Manifest is done on a variety of popular computers and mobile devices (Macbook Pros, etc.). This hardware has its own complex supply chain, and Manifest is possible only as a result of the worldwide connections those chains bring into being.

location.address: Foxconn Headquarters No.2, 2nd Donghuan Road, Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, China

overview.name: Fordham University
overview.description: Manifest is currently developed as a research project at Fordham's Department of Communication and Media Studies, with additional funding provided by the Office of Research.

location.address: Fordham University, Martino Hall, 45 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023

overview.name: New York University
overview.description: Manifest's initial development was supported by New York University's Department of Media, Culture, and Communication.

location.address: 239 Greene Street, Floor 8. New York, NY 10003

overview.name: MIT Center for Civic Media
overview.description: Manifest has its conceptual origins in work done at the MIT Center for Civic Media.
